name: larcenous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe someone who takes something that does not belong to them, without illegally entering a building to do so, or to describe something that relates to such a crime: The larcenous bunch has been creeping into parks, cutting up fallen trees, and hauling the wood out of the forest. Alan has concocted a larcenous scheme designed to get his hands on JC's money. See
larceny
More examplesFewer examplesThey are nothing more than larcenous thugs.Certain agents are frankly larcenous.The defendant obtained his employer's money by the use of forged checks with larcenous intent.
